question: What is Ming Tjong's background and how long has he lived in San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong is originally from Indonesia and moved to the United States when he was 27 years old. He has been living in San Francisco for 27 years, although he spent his first year in Nashville, Tennessee.
source_text: my name is Xiao Ming Chong but people call me by Ming is easier and originally Im from Indonesia and I moved here when I was 27 years old so Ive been living here for 27 years now and I called San Francisco home for now and so youve lived in San Francisco the whole 27 years actually I spent my first year my very first year in Nashville Tennessee

question: What was Ming Tjong's initial experience with housing costs in San Francisco?
answer: When Ming Tjong moved from Nashville to San Francisco in 1995, he was shocked by the high cost of living. In Nashville, he paid $400 for a two-bedroom apartment, but in San Francisco, the prices were much higher.
source_text: so the housing story housing story is um first when I moved from Nashville to San Francisco I was shocked the price everything was so expensive compared to Nashville back in 1995 so I used to live in two bedrooms apartment in Nashville and I paid maybe four hundred dollars for that

question: Why did Ming Tjong decide to buy a house in 2005?
answer: Ming Tjong and his family were living in a 900 square feet, two-bedroom apartment with five people, which was too small. They were forced to buy a house in 2005 because of the lack of space.
source_text: but right after my before my son was born actually my brother-in-law came and and they lived with us so and when my son was born it was five of us with the 900 square feet it was definitely too small so even though we were not ready in 19 2000 2004 2005. even though I was we were not ready to buy any house but we have to we were forced to buy a house in 2005 because uh five of us living in 900 square feet with two bedroom is almost like there is no space for everyone thats the reason why we have to buy the house in 2005.

question: How did Ming Tjong manage to buy a house in San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong bought a house in 2005 by taking advantage of a good credit score, which allowed him to pay a five percent down payment. He was eligible for a zero down payment program but chose to pay five percent.
source_text: we still remember I still remember in 2005. we paid only five percent on payment for the house even that time because of our credit score was good I would I would say excellent we were uh actually we were eligible to pay seared on payment that time so if I didnt take the zero down payment we paid five percent

question: What impact did the 2008 housing collapse have on Ming Tjong's property?
answer: During the 2008 housing collapse, the price of Ming Tjong's house in San Francisco dropped by 15-20% for a few months but then quickly recovered.
source_text: and it turns out in 2008 there was a housing collapse because I think the bank was a little bit too aggressive so yeah so a long story short we owned the house in 43rd Avenue right now for the last 17 years and we are really grateful for that

question: How did the COVID-19 pandemic affect Ming Tjong's business?
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on Ming Tjong's business, but things are almost back to normal now, although not 100% yet.
source_text: pandemic conflict was really big impact to my business but now everything is almost back to normal but still not 100 yet

question: What is Ming Tjong's view on the relationship between housing prices and business in San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong believes there is a big relationship between affordable housing prices and business. When housing prices are high, people become more price-sensitive and cut back on expenses like eating out, which impacts businesses.
source_text: I think there is a big relationship between uh the the affordable housing price with the business because its my clients uh when the price of the housing wasnt that high even before before coffee I think theres uh theyre a little bit more generous in spending so they are not that much of a price sensitive but now I think its a little bit price sensitive especially during coffee too

question: What is Ming Tjong's opinion on building more housing in San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong believes building more housing in San Francisco is the best solution to keep middle-income families in the city, which is crucial for small businesses like his. However, he acknowledges the challenges due to limited land and high costs.
source_text: no definitely definitely I will choose to build more housing in San Francisco if its possible because like you said this is a complex issue its not only keep building the house but whos going to find this money so yeah building more housing in San Francisco will be the best solution in my opinion because all the middle income family or the middle class family they can afford to live in the city because otherwise it will drive them out from the city and then and whos going to live in the city because all small businesses like mine really depends on our class of family

question: What challenges does Ming Tjong see in owning both a house and a business in San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong sees owning both a house and a business in San Francisco as almost impossible for middle-class families due to high costs. It's a dream that requires significant financial resources.
source_text: I think thats a very very difficult you know I would say its almost impossible because owning a business in San Francisco is one thing but only your house nearby your business I think thats a thats everyones dream yeah so I think theres two different things because uh owning your house thats one thing thats very difficult its like lets just put it this way its an American Dream to have your own house in big city like San Francisco so odinga house thats very hard and its even harder owning a business and also on your uh uh house and business nearby thats almost impossible

question: What is the most important issue that needs to be addressed for people to start a business in San Francisco?
answer: The city leaders need to ensure the safety of the neighborhood and community because if you don't feel safe even to live in the city, why would you run a business there?
source_text: I think the city or the city leaders need to make sure that the safe of the neighborhood the community the safety I think thats the number one issue because even right now when I close the restaurant I dont feel good about it knowing that someone might rob me and for small money and yeah I think uh before trying to put everything else I think they need to to take out the safety issue first because if you dont feel safe even to live in the city why would you run a business in the city

question: Why are people moving out of San Francisco?
answer: Many people are moving out of San Francisco because of safety concerns.
source_text: as you see theres a lot of people moving out from San Francisco and those people is not the business minded person its just a regular person and every you got so many people moving out from the city because of the safety reason

question: What is the issue with building new housing in dense communities in San Francisco?
answer: If you build new housing in a very dense community and don't provide parking space, it will frustrate people.
source_text: if you built a new housing in like a very dense community and you dont provide parking space you will make everyone get so angry I mean they they will be frustrated 100 so parking space please do plant parking space

question: Why do some families prefer to dine outside of San Francisco?
answer: Some families prefer to dine outside of San Francisco because of the lack of parking spots.
source_text: I know this family is prefer to go down south to Millbrae to Birmingham to have their meal or lunch or dinner instead of going to the city just because of the parking spot

question: What challenges do young graduates face in buying a house in San Francisco?
answer: Young graduates face challenges in buying a house in San Francisco because they are often unaware of how expensive housing is until they realize they need to work many years to afford it.
source_text: I think that a young person who just graduated from college I think thats they they have no clue or maybe they they have a lot of problems to generate money to buy a house in San Francisco so yeah after they graduate from college they dont know how much how expensive is the housing in San Francisco so when the reality kicks in they know wow I need to work another 35 years straight and then we and yeah and all my income has to be putting in the safe in order for me to afford the house in San Francisco

question: What does the city or state need to do to help prospective homeowners in San Francisco?
answer: The city or state needs to provide more programs to help prospective homeowners, as current programs like BMR and down payment assistance are insufficient.
source_text: the city or maybe the state need to uh to help the uh uh the prospective home owners to have their house first without with a lot of programs I know the city has the BMR like a down payment assistance but unfortunately uh they dont have enough of these programs thats always the problem

question: What are some positive aspects of living in San Francisco according to Ming Tjong?
answer: San Francisco has a diverse landscape with hills, ocean, and parks, and the weather is perfect, requiring minimal clothing changes between seasons.
source_text: San Francisco in general I love the city so much this is like I said at the beginning this is my home now its um that the landscape is not boring so there is a hill ocean and park so yeah everything about San Francisco is really really good and especially the weather in San Francisco its unbelievable I mean you can all you can just have like a two set of clothing and summer and and winter and thats it you dont need to prepare anything else because the weather is just perfect

question: What concerns does Ming Tjong have about the current state of San Francisco?
answer: Ming Tjong is concerned about the increase in crime, homelessness, and housing issues in San Francisco over the past few years.
source_text: I hope the city leaders can do something to make San Francisco better because the last five years I would say right beginning coffee maybe the last four years San Francisco unfortunately San Francisco is going downhill but the crime and with all the the homeless issues the housing issues

question: Why is it important to address petty crime in San Francisco?
answer: Addressing petty crime is important because it can lead to more serious crimes if left unchecked.
source_text: the Pedic line please dont take very crime easily because the the bank robbers and all this big crime is coming from the petty crime because if you let it slide all the time and then its becoming like their practice ground before theyre becoming a real threat a real problem so lets handle all this thing from the beginning if before it gets out of hand
